title: How  riot can easily impliment a change to improve the experience players have in ranked play
body:
The system already exists oddly enough. The real problem with ranked play is that everyone on both the winning team and losing team are either rewarded or punished equally which creates a big meaningless pile of chaos of players with their skill of play rarely objectively measuring their skill at the game. I can go 0/20/0 and win a game where the rest of my team went 20/0/20 and I will walk away from that ranked match with the EXACT SAME REWARD as my teammates who clearly are superior players who deserve a far larger reward than I do for that win, this isn't fair and it only ensures a longer number of games will be required to sift players to their true rank. The current system also leads to immense passive toxicity, you all seen it, player x is angry and sabotage's the match in a way that isn't intentional feeding, and they don't type mean things and thus they will never been punished. I am talking about that silent player who QQ's they didn't get a gank and then sits alone in the lane or jungle never participating in the game for example turning the game essentially into a 4 v 5.

Riot already implemented a system that gauges a players relative contribution based on performance metrics That grading you get a the end of the game... All riot has to do is implement a scaling LP reward or penalty that is augmented by that scale. So when that person goes 1/12/4  and gets a C is lucky enough to be on the winning team they get a very small reward of LP, and vice verse that person who goes 20/2/12 gets and S+ on the losing team with everyone else being 1/12/5 C rating they get a very mild penalty for that loss. Suddenly the system will start to sift people faster and more accurately to their proper rank and reduce the noise created by all the people who are carried or feed hard.

It will also help curb a lot of the passive toxicity which many of us find far more frustrating than a player who types omg jungle sux.


TLDR Use the current grading system to tailor lp gains and loses to the players contribution or lack thereof. Average performance would get typical lp gains or losses, below average will get lower lp gains or larger losses, and a higher performance would get greater gains or lesser losses all relative to their teams average performance.

I sat through that entire video just for you. 14 minutes of my time so please read.

First, I didnt mention kda at all as the factor. I said current grading system. Let us acknowledge this one actual fact here. 

Second, this braum, would not get a high grade if he only had a high kda. That is NOT how the grade system works. It is a factor of the entire game, both yeams performance, and statistical averages. And this is what we are talking about. Hard in game stats, facts that are present every game.

Last, this is more so from personal experience over about 5 years of playing, which is just my experience and of course may differ from others. To win in ranked, it is up to me to solo carry in at least 9/10 games. I use many programs to monitor my performance and do not use my feelings to gauge my performance. I perform at platinum or higher nearly EVERY SINGLE GAME. This is high performance at everything ranging from objectives, ganking, team fighting, cs, kda, warding, time to build items, playstyle, everything. If I EVER make a mistake it is an insta loss for me in these 9/10 games. The 1/10th game I am still not running anywhere close to a 040... I consider anything under 3kda to be harmful to the team in most situations so I am talking a 2.5kda or so. That is me getting shut down hard. I also have had over a 60% win rate the past couple years. 

Despite all this, I have only managed to sit through enough games to get myself to Gold. I find no reward in having to ALWAYS BE the best player on the team in order to simply get a win, while 2/5 people just get carried along, sometimes 3/5. It is simply frustrating, unfair, and most importantly unfun to myself and others who may be on the enemy team as I will stomp people in the elo I am stuck in if I get even 3/5 people participating. Sure if I played 500 games a season I could break the system and climb to platinum with a measly 51% win ratio, but what is the fun  in grinding games simply hoping you get a fair team. 

Enough ranting, point is the current system is toxic, yes toxic. I am sure most angry behaviors come from the system itself. I simply feel something better would be greatly beneficial.

Fighting over CS would become toxic and other such situations that arise from the priorities outlined in whatever formula we come up with. 

Maintain your 60% win rate and you'll climb to where you should be really quickly no matter what system is used.

Glad you asked. Every person is different. Every person has their own ideas or reasons for doing what they do. This includes playing a game, in this case League of Legends. As morticianjohn explained in his video, that could be simply having a top kda, maybe you want to play bard adc, maybe you play for fun, maybe you are serious, maybe you are a smurf and get paid to play, maybe you want to stay in silver elo because you like the difficulty(as in throw games to stay), or maybe you play to troll and cause misery. As you can see, everyone has their own reasons. You can not say "everyone is always playing to win." And that is not a big deal, this is a game and fun should not be a problem. 

The problem is that the current system does not take any of these different ideals, factors, personalities, or agendas into play. Win/loss is just a bad system period. I am not saying that winning and losing is not a key factor, I am just saying it for sure shouldn't be the only factor. Especially with all the data we have available today. I feel a more versatile system would make climbing harder, as well as easier, and most importantly you will walk away knowing you earned or didn't earn what you got.

They had that in Overwatch and had to remove it for higher ranks because it ruined match quality. Instead of trying to win people would pick certain heroes and pad a certain stat and they'd still end up top 500 on the server with something crazy like a 30% win rate.
You can't quantify everything that goes into a win anyway, so it's only gonna benefit people who gets lots of kills or CS. People already complain on the boards that in order to get an S on supports you have to steal CS and kills. Imagine when everyone starts doing that every game so they can maximize their LP gain.
People only see what they want(to get out of silver) but they don't realize once they get out it's not gonna be what they thought it would be.

I only hope

Gold VS Gold
Just like this

I do not understand
Why do I often face the silver player
But I'm just a bronze player

Cause your border has nothing to do with your skill. They match you based on MMR like in most if not all ranked games. If they matched you based on your tier the matches would be even more uneven. You could have Challenger MMR but still be in Bronze cause you dodged all your promos. Dodging only causes your LP to drop but not your MMR.

Because you and that silver player have similar MMRS.

If you tilt off the planet the second you realize you are fighting someone "higher rank" you won't ever win.

This makes ZERO sense. Your performance already has a HUGE impact on win/loss. You say it yourself how "one bad guy can lose the game". So if you worry about your PLAY that is one less person that can lose the game.

If you do all the shit you are suppose to in a game instead of feed and make stupid plays like all the players you blame for "losing you games" you might actually climb.

You can't come up with these little "side-quests to help me get out of silver" it doesn't work that way. This is a team game and it's time you get it through your head.

People don't actually get the same reward for wins or losses.

If someone is good enough to consistently win games, they will earn more lp for wins/ lose less lp for losses than someone who loses most of their games.

Its becuase of the hidden mmr system. The higher your mmr, the better players you vs and the better lp gains/losses are for you.

If you go 0/20/0 you're bad and will lose a lot of your games. You'll go down eventually. But if a Singed goes 1/9/4 and gets a C, but forces the enemy's attention top so you can secure objectives, you shouldn't be punished. Likewise, executing would lower your LP gain despite it being better than dying to an enemy. 

Few things wrong with it but I like the idea as somebody who does not usually feed.
